t: Matthew 7
Judging Others
“Do*rp not*r judge,*r or*r you*r too*r will*r be*r judged.*r
For*r in*r the*r same*r way*r you*r judge*r others,*r you*r will*r be*r judged,*r and*r with*r the*r measure*r you*r use,*r it*r will*r be*r measured*r to*r you.*r
“Why*rp do*r you*r look*r at*r the*r speck*r of*r sawdust*r in*r your*r brother’s*r eye*r and*r pay*r no*r attention*r to*r the*r plank*r in*r your*r own*r eye?*r
How*r can*r you*r say*r to*r your*r brother,*r ‘Let*r me*r take*r the*r speck*r out*r of*r your*r eye,’*r when*r all*r the*r time*r there*r is*r a*r plank*r in*r your*r own*r eye?*r
You*r hypocrite,*r first*r take*r the*r plank*r out*r of*r your*r own*r eye,*r and*r then*r you*r will*r see*r clearly*r to*r remove*r the*r speck*r from*r your*r brother’s*r eye.*r

“Do*rp not*r give*r dogs*r what*r is*r sacred;*r do*r not*r throw*r your*r pearls*r to*r pigs.*r If*r you*r do,*r they*r may*r trample*r them*r under*r their*r feet,*r and*r turn*r and*r tear*r you*r to*r pieces.*r
Ask, Seek, Knock
“Ask*rp and*r it*r will*r be*r given*r to*r you;*r seek*r and*r you*r will*r find;*r knock*r and*r the*r door*r will*r be*r opened*r to*r you.*r
For*r everyone*r who*r asks*r receives;*r the*r one*r who*r seeks*r finds;*r and*r to*r the*r one*r who*r knocks,*r the*r door*r will*r be*r opened.*r
“Which*rp of*r you,*r if*r your*r son*r asks*r for*r bread,*r will*r give*r him*r a*r stone?*r
Or*r if*r he*r asks*r for*r a*r fish,*r will*r give*r him*r a*r snake?*r

If*r you,*r then,*r though*r you*r are*r evil,*r know*r how*r to*r give*r good*r gifts*r to*r your*r children,*r how*r much*r more*r will*r your*r Father*r in*r heaven*r give*r good*r gifts*r to*r those*r who*r ask*r him!*r
So*r in*r everything,*r do*r to*r others*r what*r you*r would*r have*r them*r do*r to*r you,*r for*r this*r sums*r up*r the*r Law*r and*r the*r Prophets.*r
The Narrow and Wide Gates
“Enter*rp through*r the*r narrow*r gate.*r For*r wide*r is*r the*r gate*r and*r broad*r is*r the*r road*r that*r leads*r to*r destruction,*r and*r many*r enter*r through*r it.*r
But*r small*r is*r the*r gate*r and*r narrow*r the*r road*r that*r leads*r to*r life,*r and*r only*r a*r few*r find*r it.*r
True and False Prophets
“Watch*rp out*r for*r false*r prophets.*r They*r come*r to*r you*r in*r sheep’s*r clothing,*r but*r inwardly*r they*r are*r ferocious*r wolves.*r
By*r their*r fruit*r you*r will*r recognize*r them.*r Do*r people*r pick*r grapes*r from*r thornbushes,*r or*r figs*r from*r thistles?*r
Likewise,*r every*r good*r tree*r bears*r good*r fruit,*r but*r a*r bad*r tree*r bears*r bad*r fruit.*r
A*r good*r tree*r cannot*r bear*r bad*r fruit,*r and*r a*r bad*r tree*r cannot*r bear*r good*r fruit.*r
Every*r tree*r that*r does*r not*r bear*r good*r fruit*r is*r cut*r down*r and*r thrown*r into*r the*r fire.*r
Thus,*r by*r their*r fruit*r you*r will*r recognize*r them.*r
True and False Disciples

“Not*rp everyone*r who*r says*r to*r me,*r ‘Lord,*r Lord,’*r will*r enter*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven,*r but*r only*r the*r one*r who*r does*r the*r will*r of*r my*r Father*r who*r is*r in*r heaven.*r

Many*r will*r say*r to*r me*r on*r that*r day,*r ‘Lord,*r Lord,*r did*r we*r not*r prophesy*r in*r your*r name*r and*r in*r your*r name*r drive*r out*r demons*r and*r in*r your*r name*r perform*r many*r miracles?’*r
Then*r I*r will*r tell*r them*r plainly,*r ‘I*r never*r knew*r you.*r Away*r from*r me,*r you*r evildoers!’*r
The Wise and Foolish Builders
“Therefore*rp everyone*r who*r hears*r these*r words*r of*r mine*r and*r puts*r them*r into*r practice*r is*r like*r a*r wise*r man*r who*r built*r his*r house*r on*r the*r rock.*r

The*r rain*r came*r down,*r the*r streams*r rose,*r and*r the*r winds*r blew*r and*r beat*r against*r that*r house;*r yet*r it*r did*r not*r fall,*r because*r it*r had*r its*r foundation*r on*r the*r rock.*r
But*r everyone*r who*r hears*r these*r words*r of*r mine*r and*r does*r not*r put*r them*r into*r practice*r is*r like*r a*r foolish*r man*r who*r built*r his*r house*r on*r sand.*r
The*r rain*r came*r down,*r the*r streams*r rose,*r and*r the*r winds*r blew*r and*r beat*r against*r that*r house,*r and*r it*r fell*r with*r a*r great*r crash.”*r
When*p Jesus had finished saying these things, the crowds were amazed at his teaching,
because he taught as one who had authority, and not as their teachers of the law.
